Quake steps back into the to kitchena alone. Your heart sinks deep in your chest, there's no sign of your foxy friend.

"Your friend is alive, but very shaken and in fear of his life. He asked that I put him somewhere that was out of Rombo's reach... so I've put him in my ass for the night"

Your world comes to a halt, he couldn't have just said that, could he? You're friend went from being tortured to being held captive ijn the most vile prison you could think off, that has to be worse then death. Terrified you start to sob, and desperately try to pry your way out of Quake's grasp. To think that you trusted this monster to save your friend, only to have him make foxy butt candy instead.

"Please, don't react so seriously. He's in a very safe place, where I can keep tract of him. And after what he was through this should seem like nothing more then a nap in a warm bed to him"

You look up too him, tears still welling up in your eyes. The leonid looks down at you, looking sorry for all that's happened.

"I'm not used to talking to little ones like you... Sorry if I gave you too much information about your friend. He's safe for now, and so are you. That's all that you need to know. it's getting late, and I need to finish preparing supper. I recomend you get some sleep"

121122222221211211.content:
In darkness and putrid heat you whimper. Trapped inside the foul belly of a monstrous beast, a creature who thinks of you as nothing more then an amusing snack. No one could blame you for crying now. Well, almost no one.

Around you a deep voice booms, one of comand and strength. It's the voice of the bull that ate you, and he tells you sternly "Quit your whining".... Your shocked. Aside from not knowing that he was smart of enough to talk you also never knew that he had enough gall to dictate to you how you must feel about being swallowed! As if in form of protest, you let out another louder whimper.

"Stop it in there," He booms "you worthless little piece of shit to be. I ate you. Get over it! you got a ring, you'll come back. Your better off then my last 2,000 meals, and most of them went down cursing the day I was born, not crying their widdle eyes out"

Your whimpering is almost broken by a growl. Now he's getting pissed with you for being an inferior lunch?! You can't help having been raised as a pacifist, or that your prone to fear more so then anger. AND WHAT RIGHT DOES HE HAVE TO START TALKING NOW, WHEN HE ACTED LIKE A STUPID, DROOLING BEAST BEFORE! From your eyes a torrent of tears flow, and your body is wracked with sobs. Fear and remorse flow through your body, but so does anger. Outside the beast rubs his belly, smearing your face up against the walls. It seems almost like he's rubbing your nose in the fact that you've been eaten. With a grunt he says "Oh, and now your bawling loud enough to wake the dead! You know what, I'm glad I ate you now. This spares some other giant from having to listen to your insufferable whining, you spoiled little--"

You snap.

"SPOILED LITTLE WHAT?!! YOU GOTTA BE THE ABSOLUTE MOST HORRID CREATURE TO WALK THE EARTH! Your brazen, loud, smelly, unhygenic, stupid, vain, and you don't know how to shut your stupid trap! Yeah I'm scared in here, who wouldn't be? Any guy with half a brain cell would be terrified and disgusted right about now, and what if you'd eaten someone who was claustraphobic?!?! You can't blame me for your poor freakin tasty of food. If your gonna be picky then look for a better selection, and if your gonna be disgusted with me then puke your @#$%-ing guts up so we can both walk away from this *#@*!-ing Nightmare!"

Pissed off and fearful you curl up in a ball and wait impatiently for the horrors that will come next. You stew in both gastric juices and your own hatred for the minotaur for a few minutes before finally you get a response from the titan. He sounds alot more friendly and level headed now, as he says:

"Hey, I got you to stop whining"

You groan and whimper again, this could give you a headache. All around you the minotaur's body trembles as he lets out a deep, throaty chuckle.
121122222221211211.title: Sour Beef

choices: Shut up and try your best to prove him wrong
Accept your fate and introduce yourself
1211222222212112111.content:
With another groan you slump back. Now your brain is starting to hurt, and your eyebrow is twitching uncontrollabley. The bull may have succeed in getting you to stop whinning, but somehow you feel that this was not his real motive. "At the risk of a migrain I want to ask you something. Why did you have to pester me?"

Outside the bull starts to caress his belly again, giving you even less space. His rubbing is ALOT firmer then before. You swear you can feel his big, meaty palms right through the stomach wall. "What do ya mean, pester? I was keeping myself amused, and telling you what's what"

Again you groan. This time it seems to pay off, he stops rubbing his gut. "Okay, you wanna know the real reason? I hate it when my meals whine."

You blink, and protest "But that's what you said before!"

"Ya, and I was serious too. I don't like it when meals bawl and blubber, it annoys me to hell to hear so much mindless wimpering. Mind you most of my meals don't whimper, they just curse until the bitter end, so a wimpy tears aren't a problem I 'ave to deal with often" He reply, sounding a little annoyance and comtempt showing in his deep voice.

"But you chuckled afterwards, how can you expect me to take it seriously when you chuckled" You cry out.

"I chuckled 'cause it was funny how things worked out. Before now I've never had a meal stop crying 'cause it got pissed with me" He chuckles again, and pats his belly. This time the pat seems to put you into a more comfortable postition. "There, but understand that I'm only gonna do this to keep ya from whining. And I will be eating you again little hyena snack, so you'd better get used to it"

"What!? You want to eat me again, what the hell is wrong with you? you complain beacause I'm a whiner and you keep telling me how much it disgusts you. Why would you dare to eat me again?!!"

"Cause your delicous, and your amusing.... And you need to be trained to get used to this place. If someone doesn't toughen you up then you'll never become any more then the ass-wipe you are"

"Gee, thanks" You reply sarcastically, wishing death upon the big minotaur.... Wait, did you really just say that last bit aloud? You never were much of one for sarcasm before now, you've always been more direct. In the back of your head your mind is trying hard to deny something, Something that the bull is also thinking.

Something that the bull doesn't object to saying out loud.

"See, your learning from me already!"

You aren't sure if you want to kiss the bull or kill him. You know that he's gonna be one hell of a teacher, though you aren't really sure in what respect. Might as well introduce yourself now, like any good pupil would. "Well then, mentor, you should at least know your students name. I'm Kyloo"

"Kyloo is a wierd name for a snack... but then again so is hyena. Alright then Kyloo, I am Zodius, though I'm more used to being called 'spit me out you $%*!-ing minotaur!'. Oh, and some people call me Wolf"

"Wolf?"

"Long story. Anyways you are little more then a snack, so you have to call me Zodius" He says in a very authoritative voice. "And you should know that I'm not big on talking, already I've wasted to much breath on you for one night, snack"

"Okay, okay. Now before you stop talking to me just tell me when you'll let me out of here" You call out, and wait for his reply. Minutes pass, yet an answer does not come. Hoping that maybe he just didn't hear you you call out "Hello?". You get a response but not the one you wanted. From far above echo the loud sounds of Zodius' thunderous snoring....

It's huge.. and you feel her spine through countless layers of flesh against your own back, your in a sitting position, feeling a bit icky as digestive juices start to flow around you. you stroke your ring a moment, making sure it's tight... your never sure about this... but it is at least giving you hope of returning to a dragoness who shows more affection to her meals. You feel her body move slightly then the stomach begin to churn, not being on your feet you just ride out the churning as best you can, fighting is pointless... she knew what she was doing. and at least she didn't chew.. .but definitly your going to complain to pinto, She earned your trust... this woman just scarfed you. You cover your face with your paws and sigh, this might take a while, big stomachs probally digest slowly.. goes to figure... it's very warm too.. and the stomach lining isn't all that uncomfertable... you decide to lay down, feeling her body around you, almost able to hear her chuckle. You make a deep sigh and fall asleep....

You hear Pinto murr in pleasure as you move around inside of her, trying to get to the exit.
After freeing your legs from the skeletal remains, you slide easily into the intestines, which start kneeding you as they gently push you along. But this isn't fast enough, you want to get out now! You wriggle and swim as best you can, trying to speed up. You hear Pinto murr again in pleasure, as she feels you wriggling deep within her gut, where none have done it for her before.
As you slide further and further into her body, things start to become a little, smelly. You realize what going this way will mean, at long last. You groan, this isn't going to be fun, all that nasty stuff getting into your fur, and the actual escape... but it's too late to turn back now, it would be impossible to fight your way back the way you came. So, you must go this way. Or, should you try to fight your way back, and avoid this smelly exit?

122.content:
"wait!" you call out in a feeble voice to the group of canines that you came here "Please, Please don't leave! We should stick together in case of an emergency, right? I mean we shouldn't wander off from each other, it might get dangerous". The wolf makes some sort of snort in response to this, and turns around, heading off into a side cavern. Likewise the fox, Gambo, simply shrugs and turns around to, making for a nearby tunnel that interests him. You let out a whimper and cry out. "Guys, this is a bad idea! Please, I don't want to go in there..." Brightmane seems to pay attention. The husky stops in his tracks, turns around, and walks back up to you.

"Kyloo, listen. I can understand if you're nervous about heading further in, but we came here to explore. If you don't want to come then you can stay here, set up a base fire or something. We'll be gone for a few hours" You try to mutter out a response, but Brightmane silences you and turns around, heading down a nearby tunnel, leaving you here alone in the grand cavern, looking out onto the storm.
122.title: Don't go!

choices: Leave in search of your friends
Stay put and enjoy the blaze
1221.content:
You shiver to the sound of the rain pouring down outside and in the distance a bright flash is followed by a wicked crack of thunder. Beyond the cave's grand opening it's not fit for beast or man, and being of the beast persuasion you feel it fit to wait out the storm in here. You watch Brightmane disappear into the shadows of the cave, more interested in searching the caves for riches and adventure.

Not being the adventurous sort you take Brightmane's advice and stay at the main entrance, collecting sticks and bramble that have built up on the cavern floor. It takes a few minutes to build up and arrange a 'teepee' shaped pile that should easily burn. One strike of your flint and steel is all it takes to set some dry grass ablaze, and soon you have a roaring fire. It's truly beautiful and warm, and the amber glow casts dancing shadows upon the rough cavern walls, which are occasional lit up by distant flashes of brilliant blue lightning. Marvellous, exquisite even, you just wish there was someone else here to keep you company in this empty, lonely place and enjoy the fire with you. Tis almost enough to make you wander off in search of your friends, but fear of the caverns anchors you where you are. Besides, why leave this warm fire that you had to work to make?

Yet, your still so lonely here... maybe you could stand to venture a little ways in?
1221.title: Burning Bright

choices: Run off into the depths of the caverns
Creep back, trying to sneak around whatever it is
12211.content:
No, you definitely can not take the loneliness. The whole reason you came along was to be close to your friends. Being afraid was never part of the plan. You swallow your fears, shove aside your doubts, and with your chest puffed out you leave the warming fire behind. "See, this isn't so hard" you muse to yourself As you step of into the shadows.

In the distance, another crack of lightning illuminates the dark sky. Thunder booms ominously.

Slowly you proceed down unlit tunnels, stumbling about in the darkened caverns. It feels almost like you've stepped into the depths of some creature that's fallen asleep with you, a mere tasty morsel locked away in it's shadowy form. No longer puffed out far in front of you, your chest rises and falls with nervous breaths. Things are getting scary again, and you start to think that this was a very bad idea. You could swear you hear breathing behind you....

And that's because you do! your ears pick up the distant, heavy breathing of something big. It's not immediately behind you, but instead sounds to be back in the cavern where you started the fire. It's worked it's way in between you and your only possibly chance of escape! Your knees begin to tremble, as you conjure up images of a giant carnivorous beast that's stalking you, hoping for a bite sized hyena snack... This can't be good.
12211.title: In Search of Friends

choices: Turn around and face the newcomer
Freeze in place, scared stiff
12212.content:
Nestled next to the fire, you begin to feel at ease with the world. The crackling embers, the sweet smell of wood smoke, the warming glow, it's all so serene. Especially in comparison to the frigid rain and booming lightning that this harsh storm has brought along. Man do you hate storms like this, it feels almost like the earth is trying to cast you off in a cleansing torrent of water, wind and thunder. Not to mention that your little hut leaks like a straw basket, and offers no more protection from the wind then a panel of cheese cloth.

As you sit next to the fire, time seems to slow down. You find yourself lost in the feeling of warmth, the fire throwing off warm, enshrouding passion. If not for the need to keep the fire going, you could just fall asleep right here. Your near trance like state leaves your ability to perceive and react muted, So when you hear a big, deep voice booming coming from the entrance to the cave you nearly jump out of your skin...

"Mmmmm, a camp fire... what're you cooking?"

The voice sounds like it belongs to something HUGE. It lets out a few deep breaths, waiting for your response. You glance o the entrance, just in time for another lightning crash to light up the cave entrance, showing the pitch black silhouette of the gigantic fur. Fearful, your gaze shoots back to the fire. Your breathing gets deep as the newcomer walks in, his heavy footfalls echoing off the cavern walls. Right about now you...
12212.title: Warmth

choices: "It's nasty out there, this looked like a safe place to stay
"I LIVE here, now what's your excuse?"
122122.content:
Fearful of whatever this Creature might be, you're unable to move an inch. Completely incapacitated you sit by the fire, hoping that somehow it's comforting glow can keep you safe from the big thing...

The footsteps get closer and closer, stopping mere feet from where you sit. In spite of the heat you're shivering, teeth chattering with fear. Behind you fur shuffles as the titan leans in, his hot breath on your back. Chills run down your spine as you slowly turn to face the beast. His large snout inches into your field of view, and suddenly with a heart stopping flash of his pearly whites he opens his mouth and says in a low, quiet voice "boo".

Nearly leaping right out of your skin you jump up... and fall right back down again. Stricken by terror you faint on the spot, the last thing you see is the giant, hooting and howling with laughter.

A few minutes later you wake up, staring at the cavern ceiling. For a few seconds you just lie there, staring, tears streaming from your eyes as you listen to the not so distant sound of someone else's breathing. He's still in there, and you can feel his gaze upon you. "are you alright?" You start to whimper and quickly pull yourself up and start backing away from him. Please, don't be frightened. Says the shadow cloaked giant in a voice that sounds slightly hurt. "I'm not going to hurt you".... He leans over you, his hands cupping gently around your chubby form. Carefully he lifts you up, and as another flash of lightning illuminates the cavern you get your first look at the stranger.

He's a lemur, a ringtail to be exact. A very big one too, he looks to be almost 30 feet tall! and he's fairly muscular, his soft fur clinging to thin but well defined form. Around his neck is a large thick hoop of silver that's been formed into a beautiful collar with inward rounded edges. He has a few heavy looking silver hoops through both of his big black ringtail ears, and he wears a pair of dark silky shorts with a bright electrical looking pattern on them.

His friendly face smiles down on you, and you get a feeling that this titan is no enemy. But you're still scared, and you have to swallow your fear just to ask him a simple question "What are you doing in here?" He looks back out to the storm for a second, and responds.
122122.title: Another Traveller

choices: Lie, say that your an archeologist
Tell him why your really here
1221222.content:
The titan blinks, and in the fire's amber glow a smile spreads across his face. He leans in even closer to you, with his chest snug to the floor and his muzzle a mere arms length away and. "Me, I -live- in these caverns... so what's your excuse? No one -just- wanders into these parts of the forest by mistake."

For an instant you know not what to say. You would have just explained that you're in the cave to stay out of the storm, keeping the other details to yourself... but already he's found the biggest hole in that defense, without it even being presented. Stammering, your mind races as it tries to come up with a believable explanation for your being here. The ringtail drums his fingers on the roughly hewn floor, cocking his brow as he waits for you to speak...

You're unsure if the creature believes you.

choices: A tank perched on the desk

12311112.content:
From the safety of the big-guy's cupped paws you're escorted down a series of dimly lit corridors. The vague, softly coloured lights seem to come from an assortment of glowing gems and fungi that are strategically place on the roughly hewn stone walls. The overall affect is quite spectacular, and you find yourself in awe of the beautiful, if somewhat crude, caverns. You look up to your captor and now owner for a moment, he seems to look pleased with himself. Then you glance to his other paw, and see the figure in it start to sit up, apparently Brightmane is awake.

"Ugghhh, wha- Kyloo?" He asks as he strains to look at you in the low light. Apparently he has to common sense to stay put and not struggle against the behemoth who holds him. The lion'taur looks down to him as he looks up to the lion'taur, and as their eyes meet the husky begins to look very sheepish. In a rasp of a voice he whispers, "You didn't kill me?"

The big-guy lets out a low growl, almost like a purr of mild discontent. "You're friend feared for you're life, and being the brave little charmer that he is I let him buy you back. Otherwise you'ld be a morsel by now. Now you're both tea bags". He looks over the husky with some malcontent, while Brightmane looks to you bleary eyed.

"Kyloo..." He mutters in a hoarse whisper, "...I owe you my life. I'm sorry..." He bows down, tears running from his tightly closed eyes "...I shouldn't have asked you to come. Forgive me, I brought you to this place, got us in trouble, and you save my life for it... I... I..."

"You... you owe me nothing" You say with teary eyes and a smile "We're safe, and you should be apologizing to him". You look up to the big-guy, who still regards you're friend with suspicion. Brightmane stammers out a 'sorry' to him, and falls quiet.

"...Apology accepted little flavor inhancer, but don't expect any lightened restraints because you're remorseful. You're still a thief, and you'll still be punished... just not as harshly"

The 'Taur stops in front of a large door, and open it with the hand you're sitting in. You get your first look into the massive bedroom this titan sleeps in. It too is a massive cavern with walls carved out of the stone. All the basic bedroom furniture is there, and of course it's all hand made... "Welcome to my room little doggies" He yawns "I'll give ya a chance to look around in the morning. Right now I need my rest, and since you're day starts when mine does, so will you" He let's out another toothy yawn before showing the both of you to you're resting spot. It just so happens you'll be sleeping in:

"I'm sorry, but teabag is the best to offer, you wouldn't like the alternatives. Trust me, soaking in warm water and lending it your flavor is no different then taking a bath. It'll only happen once a day, maybe twice if some one else wants tea"

A pair of powerful arms wrap around your body, and you find yourself locked against the maned doggy who's been trapped in here. Husky's have a very powerful grip, or at least brightmane does, he's knocked the wind out of you and won't let any air get back into your lungs. Mind you a break from this foul smelling air might well have been in order anyways...

After holding you for what seems like an eterinty Brightmane lessens his grip, and your finally able to inhale. The husky touches his muzzle to yours as he finally speaks. "Kyloo, your alive"

"Yeah, more or less" You reply, fighting back an urge to blame him for this whole horrid mess. "So, how've you been holding up?"

"Well, it's not nearly as bad as it was when I first got here, I spent the first day just screaming, kicking, struggling, and biting until my throat and body was too sore to do anything but hurt. Then I just laid around and felt sorry for myself. The second day I accepted my fate as a prisoner, and felt a little thankful that I wasn't dead, and I started to worry about you and the rest of the group" Brightmane pauses for a second and almost seems to giggle at the next part "On the third day the big guy ate someone that really disagreed with him, and he had gas for the whole afternoon. for the first few minutes of it all I could do was breath through my mouth whilest my eyes watered, but after an hour I got used to the smell. It had an earthy tone to it-" He stops, probably realising that you don't want to know anymore about Earthquake's gas "Today is the fourth day, so far I've done nothing but laze around and wish there was someone here to keep me company" Brightmane gives you another crushing hug and presses his head to your shoulder "I guess Quake granted my wish, eh?"

Okay, so apparently your friend wasn't as mortified as you thought he would be. He seems kinda neutral on being here, which is something of a bizarre prospect. Maybe it comes with adaption, or insanity. Either way you just wanna get out "Yeah, I guess he did... listen, I really don't want to stick around in here, it's way to vile for my liking. info.description:
Well Well Well, A member of a pack of dogs and kin you have decided on a great adventure, into the old forests, seaching for the legendary treasures. As your party continues to move into the forest darkness gets worse, and the trees get bigger, Well prepared you take out a lantern and light it. Looking into the darkness a huge cave entrance looms ahead of you, easily over a hunred feet high, the base of the mountain.

Please add a chapter, can't keep writting em all myself, there are plenty of branches to explore.

The story will evolve how you wish it, but most likely with both good and bad endings, and lots of adventure
